c74object.name: cage.rhythminterp

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the rhythm obtained from the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet is interpreted as a list of interpolation weights to be assigned to the onset/duration couples received in the second and third inlets. The weights are normalized so as that their sum always equals 1.
An llll in the second inlet must be composed of sublists of onsets. An llll in the third inlet must be composed of sublists of durations.

attribute.name: epsilon
attribute.description: The epsilon attribute sets the minimum onset and duration distances (in milliseconds) for two notes of the resulting rhythm to be considered duplicates. If the thin attribute is not active, epsilon is ignored. The default is 10 10.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: If the mode attribute is set to 0, interpolating between rhythms with different numbers of chords may produce a rhythm with more chords than any of its contributors. If it is set to 1, the number of notes of the resulting rhythm is always limited to the number of notes of the largest contributor. The default is 0.

attribute.name: thin
attribute.description: If the thin attribute is set to 1 (default), duplicate notes in the resulting rhythm, defined according to the epsilon attribute, will be removed.

c74object.discussion: cage.rhythminterp is conceived to work in conjunction with nodes. If rhythms do not have the same number of chords, the module is capable of adding additional rhythmic events to smooth out the interpolation.
